attributes.action: Allow gyms/exercise classes to stay open during lockdown.
attributes.background: I call on the government not to close gyms during lockdown. Gyms should not be put in the same category as hospitality, in terms of risk. Gyms are following strict social distancing and Covid safe guidelines where members are following the rules in a soberly fashion.
attributes.additional_details:
Now more than ever Gyms 
and exercise classes are essential for physical and mental well being. Physical activity has been shown to boost the immune system. The release of endorphins can prevent stress and illness. At this stressful time people need exercise in a safe, structered environment. Maintaining a regular exercise regime at home can be difficult in terms of lack of space, the cost of expensive equipment, distractions and a lack of motivation. Please rethink your decision to close gyms as the long term negative affect on the physical and mental health of the public will without doubt impact the NHS, when it is under great pressure to cope with Covid-19.

attributes.action: Reclose universities due to increase in COVID-19 cases
attributes.background: I would like the government to consider closing universities and move to online teaching allowing us to have access to education while being safe at home.
attributes.additional_details: The number of COVID-19 cases is increasing, making on-campus classes an increasingly threatening environment for students and the family members who live with them. There is also currently a huge inequality of opportunities between on-campus and online classes. Students who attend on-campus classes are much more favored, making it unfair for students who want to attend classes online. Closing universities would favor a much safer and more equitable environment for students.

attributes.action: Make supermarkets display the climate impact of the products they sell
attributes.background: The government should make it obligatory for supermarkets to display the climate impact of products they sell to enable consumers to make informed choices about what they buy. This could be done in a similar format to the existing traffic lights labelling system used for nutritional information.
attributes.additional_details: We know that changing our diets is one way of lowering individual carbon footprints as part of the broader effort to prevent climate catastrophe. Yet, consumers currently lack sufficient information to make informed choices about the products they buy and consume. Providing such information in the form of a standardised labelling system could help consumers to choose more sustainable diets and will raise awareness of the impact that certain foods can have on our environment.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321482

attributes.action: Ban the sale of loud 'explosive' fireworks to the general public.
attributes.background:
Make it illegal to set off these explosive fireworks in housing estates.
Allow the sale of pretty, quieter fireworks to the general public to use in the home environment.
Allow the sale of these loud explosive fireworks to licenced organisers only and only for use in organised public displays.
attributes.additional_details: Every year from mid October until 31st Dec, many members of the public find it amusing to set off VERY LOUD EXPLOSIVE fireworks.     This is not for entertainment, their only purpose is to frighten and shock.  It causes misery to older people, mentally disturbed people and frightens children and animals. The explosions are random so you cannot make any preparations to avoid the noise.  It is my Human Right to enjoy a quiet peaceful home life and not have to endure this 'bombing' every night.

attributes.action: Update the education system and introduce subjects for 21st century learning.
attributes.background: I propose we update the education system to introduce subjects which are primed for 21st century learning. Finance, technology, the environment - all key areas I believe we should be teaching the leaders of the future about at the earliest stage.
attributes.additional_details: Learning how to start your own company, plan and manage your personal finances, create innovative and pioneering ideas to help shape the future of tomorrow and protect the world we live in - why do we not teach our children about these fundamentally critical topics? Why are we not focusing on making the world of tomorrow a better place? Why do we still have an outdated education system based on a world of over 50+ years ago? In a world thats changing at pace, let's not leave our children behind.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. The environment, technology and finance are all included as part of the national curriculum.  You can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/national-curriculum
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Implement 3 Pillars to vanquish Covid19: underpinned by Testing & a Risk Waiver.
attributes.background:
The 3 Pillars to vanquish Covid19 are:
1.	Shield all vulnerable 
2.	Furlough 60-65's 
3.	Allow <60's to re-establish the economy and schools. 
Underpinned by Testing on exception basis, and an online Risk Waiver.
attributes.additional_details:
Evidence in the public domain demonstrate that current Govt measures are ineffectual, for example:
1. Concerns raised by the Majors (eg Andy Burnham in Grt Manchester) of the cities impacted by local lockdowns,  
2. Condemnation of Govt performance on Testing (eg Dr Gabriel Scully)

The proposed 3 Pillars seek to provide the solution to create the environment in which to either vanquish the covid19 virus or diminish it to nominal insignificance ie near zero-covid, and with fewer deaths.

rejection.details:
We understand that you want the Government to change its approach to the Covid-19 outbreak, but it's not clear exactly how this would work, including what you mean by "Testing on exception basis" or "an online Risk Waiver".

We have published the following petitions, some of which you might like to sign:

Fund & provide services to allow the vulnerable to shield & re-open the economy: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552023

Lift local lockdowns and Covid-19 restrictions in England: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/551469

You could start a new petition stating more clearly what changes you want the Government to make to its approach to Covid-19.

attributes.action: Do a full environmental impact assessment of HS2
attributes.background: Stop immediately the destruction of trees on the route of HS2.  It makes no sense to be trying to plant trees to prevent global warming and and at the same time to destroy ancient forests which are over 400 years old.  Since Covid the need for commuting has decreased.
attributes.additional_details: We need more time to assess whether the impact of the trees destroyed will have a serious adverse effect on the carbon levels in our environment.  A measurement of the loss of carbon absorption caused by woodland destruction needs to be made.  New trees are small and do not always survive.  The need for commuter transport is dropping.  Home working has increased and has been found to be very efficient for business.  During the Covid lockdown, naure walks have been vital in maintaining well being for people.  Many natural habitats will be lost if HS2 goes ahead.  By the time it HS2 can be built, it will probably not be needed.  Woodland ecosystems will be destroyed which can never be replaced.  We do not have the right to cause such devastation to the natural world.

rejection.details:
Environmental statements have already been published for each stage of HS2:

Phase One: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/hs2-phase-one-environmental-statement-documents

Phase 2a: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/hs2-phase-2a-environmental-statement

Phase 2b: https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/hs2-phase-2b-working-draft-environmental-statement

It's not clear what further information you want to be published.

We have already published a number of petitions about HS2, some of which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&q=hs2

attributes.action: Repeal the Greater Manchester Spatial Framework (in all of forms).
attributes.background: We would like the national Government to step in and prevent the local Councils of Greater Manchester from developing on green belt land.
attributes.additional_details: The green belt of Greater Manchester is vitally important to all local residents. Developing on this land would have a huge impact on the local flora and fauna, and the negatives affects on the health and wellbeing of local residents far outweigh the need for additional homes. Greater Manchester has an abundance of brownfield sites that can be utilised to help with the housing crisis without damaging our natural habitats and environment.

rejection.details:
Deciding on local planning policies is a matter for individual local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to ban all development on the green belt, to prevent local authorities from authorising development in these areas.

attributes.action: All MPs to take a pay cut to 80% of their salary
attributes.background: All UK MPs to take a pay cut to 80% of their salary in line with the majority of the country. MP's may talk about being 'in it together' but they sit in a secure and subsidised environment. This pay cut and the money raised can contribute towards the Corona Pandemic by helping those affected.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament have ignored the self employed and are closing large sectors of the economy. They don't had the slightest concept of how this feels. Perhaps a 20% pay cut may help them focusing on the needs of the country as a whole

rejection.details:
The UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for setting MPs' pay. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out more about IPSA here: https://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/

attributes.action: Remove parking restrictions on Derby Road, between Kimbolton Av and Arundel St
attributes.background: As small independent businesses we rely on the limited parking available in this busy area. To remove some of these vital spaces will greatly impact customers being able to get to us. In the first week since the measures were put in place, we have had a 30% drop in revenue.
attributes.additional_details: We do not oppose the one way systems on the side streets and hope this will alleviate some traffic issues on Derby Road. However the removal of spaces to pull in and park will cause irreparable harm to our businesses in this already turbulent environment. The removal of spaces has been labelled for social distancing measures, we see no reason for this to be helpful. Much of our customers are in transit and if they cannot pull up close by will go elsewhere.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for the local authority. 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Petition to make physical education (P.E) everyday uniform.

attributes.additional_details: Petition to make physical education everyday uniform as pupils feel more comfortable and relaxed in an working environment. Wearing this allows pupils to remain relaxed and calm which assists there education. The majority of pupils prefer to wear there physical education kit everyday than there own as they don't have to worry about being made fun of for wearing a certain thing. They also like wearing this as it enables them to do more in a lesson as they don't have to change before and after.

rejection.details: It is for the governing body of a school, not the Government or House of Commons, to decide whether there should be a school uniform policy and if so what that should be, and whether there should be a separate uniform for different activities, such as PE.

attributes.action: Require cyclist to dismount and give way to vehicles on roads and pass a test
attributes.background: Assess the impact cyclists Have on emissions due to several vehicles having to follow a single cyclist for miles as overtaking safely is not possible. Pass a law requiring cyclists to pass a test to be permitted to cycle on roads and require cyclists to dismount and give way to vehicles
attributes.additional_details: A cyclist can at times cause 10-20 vehicles to have to travel at low speed resulting in higher fuel consumption and emissions from the vehicles following which in turn causes far more harm to the environment than benefit of the one cyclist. Cyclists show a blatant disregard for rules of the roads by passing through red lights and travelling in the middle of roads making it impossible to pass.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure when you'd like cyclists to be required to dismount, for example whenever there's any vehicle behind them, and how this would work in practice. 
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Change school uniform policy to help Environment, Industry, and Agriculture
attributes.background:
Introduce a school uniform scheme where uniforms are made from natural wool fleece products that are subsidised/rented to parents.
Give farmers a fair price for fleece.
Provide jobs in manufacturing for old mill towns.
Save the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
To support 
British Industry 
British Agriculture
Parents of school children
The Environment
Reduce, slave labour products, environmental miles and school heating bills

The Government is not responsible for school uniforms. It is up to  the governing body of a school to decide whether there should be a school
uniform policy and if so what that should be, not the Government or House of Commons.

attributes.action: For transparency purposes, Parliamentarians should vote on the US-UK Trade Deal.
attributes.background: Preliminary negotiations for a trade deal with the US  began in 2016, before the European Referendum took place. Since then negotiations with the US have proceeded in earnest but veiled in secrecy,  why?
attributes.additional_details:
A US -UK trade deal is likely to have a profoundly negative impact on the lives of people in the UK. Many regulations that have kept us and the environment safe will disappear along with animal welfare standards.

Let's be clear, a Trade Deal with the US will be in reality a trade deal between the U.K and ruthless multinational corporations that wield huge amounts of power. Most trade deals contain clauses known as ISDS clauses, (Investor State Dispute Settlement) whereby governments can be fined millions of pounds if an investor's profits are reduced in any way. Big business is likely to play a major but negative part in our lives in the future.
 
Parliamentarians should be granted a final vote on the US trade deal; secrecy must be lifted in support of transparency and democracy.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320264

attributes.action: Ban all imports of wood and meat from Brazil into the United Kingdom
attributes.background: To save the Amazon rain forests and subsequently the World
attributes.additional_details: We all need to do more to save our planet; stopping imports of wood and meat from Brazil will show to the world our Government's true attitude and determination to help the natural environment to recover.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/327422.

attributes.action: Grant the Environment Agency powers to monitor and penalise water companies.
attributes.background: Water companies and landowners should be monitored by the Environment Agency and if they are found to be polluting rivers they should be penalised. There should be investment in the sewage system so that it operates more efficiently in extreme weather conditions.
attributes.additional_details: In 2016 the government acknowledged that only 14% of English rivers are in good ecological condition.  Despite this they have not brought in measures to monitor how water companies and landowners are misusing our rivers and ,through the Environment Agency,  are not penalizing companies and landowners who routinely pollute our waterways. Last year 1.5m hours of raw sewage was pumped into English rivers posing a serious risk to human health as well as damaging the environment.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330416

attributes.action: Make it illegal for vehicle drivers to leave engines idling when stationary.
attributes.background: Fine vehicle drivers who pollute by leaving their engine idling, and give licence penalty points.
attributes.additional_details: Such behaviour seems to be on the increase. It can be witnessed daily in my small town, and even when politely challenged, drivers do not turn their engines off. Such willful and totally unnecessary damage to public health and the environment cannot be left in the hands of vehicle drivers to do as they wish, but should be made an offence. The public should then be given the tools to report such offenders. Air pollution kills thousands of people a year, and protecting the environment is the responsibility of all of us, not some.

rejection.details:
It is already the law that, when a vehicle is stationary, drivers must stop the engine of a car, unless certain exceptions apply. There are also legal provisions for local authorities to be granted powers to issue fixed penalty fines in relation to idling offences.

Decisions about enforcement action are a matter for local police forces and local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons.

You could start a petition calling on the Government to change the rules around vehicle idling, by increasing penalties or broadening the offence, but you would need to make it clear how you want current rules to change.

attributes.action: Stop Calories Being Displayed on Menus to Care for Those with Eating Disorders
attributes.background: The Government needs to rethink and remove the policy to add calories on menus to make “more informed choices”. This could trigger those with an eating disorder and could cause more eating disorders in maybe the most vulnerable generation around the country, the kids we are trying to protect
attributes.additional_details: Covid-19 has created a hostile environment for those suffering from an eating disorder. 1.25 million people in the UK have their lives controlled by counting calories that would only be heightened by this change, so this policy is most certainly not a “fair deal” for everyone.  We should be making life more accessible and less triggering for this not-so-small minority as to not increase the rate of the mental health issue with the highest mortality rate in the country. Weight does not equal health

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332940

attributes.action: Mandatory country of manufacture identification on all goods sold in UK.
attributes.background: Make it mandatory that all goods offered for sale in the UK must clearly state, both on packaging and any form of advertising, the country of manufacture and parent company details. This will allow consumers to make an informed decision when choosing products.
attributes.additional_details: Currently we, as consumers, have very little means of knowing the origin of many of the products available for sale, with identifying the parent company and country of manufacture made almost impossible. In todays environment many of us would like, and have a right, to make an informed decision on the products we purchase, whether it be for ethical, environmental, or other reasons. Without clear information available we are left buying products "blindly". This situation must change.

rejection.details:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/309019

You may also wish to sign these similar petitions:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324122
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320699

attributes.action: Reduce the Retirement Age. Get young people working!
attributes.background: Free up jobs for younger people, boost the economy, create a safer working environment
attributes.additional_details: Reduce the age of retirement allowing people to collect their pension early. Which, in turn, allows the younger people who are less likely to be a risk of Covid 19 back into work to boost the economy.

rejection.details:
It is not clear to what age you would like the state pension age to be changed to.

You may wish to sign these petitions instead: 

Reduce the state pension age to 60 to better support the elderly: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302965

Decrease the state pension age for both men and women to 62 now: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/319691

attributes.action: Make it possible for public to report engine idling to reduce carbon emissions
attributes.background:
There is currently no way of reporting motorists who are parked up but are deliberately leaving their engine idling. 

This is bad for the environment, and our health. 

We need an app or similar that can be used on a phone to report engine idling, and for this to result in actions
attributes.additional_details:
The Highway Code states that drivers must not leave a parked vehicle with the engine running while that vehicle is stationary on a public road.

Local authorities can issue £20 fixed penalties for emission offences, but this is imposed only if a motorist refuses to switch off engine when asked by an authorised person. 

Engine idling is a pointless and unnecessary contributor to carbon emissions, as well as being bad for our health. The current legislation is ineffective and needs to be reviewed

rejection.details:
This is a matter for individual police forces, not the UK Government or Parliament.

In any case, vehicle idling is an offence under the Road Traffic (Vehicle Emissions) (Fixed Penalty) (England) Regulations 2002. The public can therefore already report suspected vehicle idling to their local police force by phone and any other means of communication they accept.

You could start a petition calling for a review of the efficacy of the law in reducing unnecessary vehicle emissions, if that is something you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Open tattoo studios on 4th July with other non essential business
attributes.background: Tattoo studios are sterile safe environments. There is a lot less risk of infection then in hairdressers pubs etc. They should be allowed to open with other non essential businesses on July 4th.
attributes.additional_details: Businesses are suffering. It’s unnecessary to be closed when other businesses can open that are a greater risk of passing on germs then a sterile tattoo studio

rejection.details:
We have already published this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/320507

Since you started your petition the Government has announced businesses including beauty salons, nail bars and tattoo studios can reopen safely from Monday 13 July: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/beauty-salons-set-to-reopen-for-some-services-next-week-under-new-government-guidelines

The Government has published guidance for people who provide close contact services, including hairdressers, barbers, beauticians, tattooists, sports and massage therapists, dress fitters, tailors and fashion designers: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/working-safely-during-coronavirus-covid-19/close-contact-services

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/

attributes.action: Stop the government wasting £900,000 painting a plane red, white and blue.
attributes.background: £900,000 of TAXPAYERS money to paint a plane is a ridiculous idea and will be of no use to anyone. The country is in more debt then ever and this money should go towards other causes which would greatly benefit the people in the country or outside!
attributes.additional_details: I want the government to reconsider spending the money on a much better cause such as poverty, homelessness or the pandemic going on right now. Anything other than painting a plane!! There are so many important causes which would benefit so much from this amount of money and painting a plane is not one of them. The government could use this money to help the environment or help other poorer countries which cannot cope because of the pandemic.

rejection.details: By the time your petition was started, the plane had already been painted. It's not clear what action can be taken now.

attributes.action: Make the wearing of face coverings mandatory in schools,colleges&universities.
attributes.background: Mandatory wearing of face coverings in schools,colleges & universities should be in line with most public spaces but is not. Schools educate - they should be leading by example to show younger people the importance of this safety measure especially if distancing is reduced & class sizes increase.
attributes.additional_details: Face coverings at the moment are optional in schools yet all will be wearing coverings on public transport. If face coverings are expected in other areas of society, schools should be leading by example.If distancing is reduced this safety measure is vital in small classroom settings and in school buildings which make government safety guidance challenging to put into action-with poor ventilation and narrow corridors. Schools are environments of high risk for transmission and need more support.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330227

attributes.action: Hair and Beauty salons need proper guidelines in place for when we can reopen.
attributes.background: We need proper guidelines in place regarding health and safety. Hair and beauty salons need to feel safe and ready to open and to protect their clients and staff. Professionals are used to working in hygienic environments where cleanliness is paramount and tools sterilized after each client.
attributes.additional_details: The guidelines will allow salon owners, freelance and mobile hair and beauty professionals to plan for their reopening and make the necessary changes to their protocols to operate in a safe and appropriate way when the time is right. This will be individual choice once the UK Government has confirmed an opening date instead of being left in a world of wonder. The sense of wellness associated with a hair or beauty treatment should not be underestimated and business owners need to have an income.

attributes.action: Increase the price of meat, especially beef.
attributes.background:
Have heavy taxes on meat products. Excluding free range meat.
Set minimum prices for meat to decrease it’s consumption.
The extra taxes collected should go to alternative meats, such as lab meat or corn meat. 
Meat alternatives should have maximum prices to increase their consumption.
attributes.additional_details:
Meat is very bad for the environment. 
Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) estimated that total annual emissions from animal agriculture (production emissions plus land-use change) were about 14.5% of all human emissions

To produce one kilogram of beef requires 25 kilograms of grain – to feed the animal – and roughly 15,000 litres of water. If everyone gave up meat we could feed An extra 1.4 billion people.

Over a billion farmed animals in Britain are killed each year in slaughterhouses.

rejection.details:
We understand that you're concerned about meat consumption and the environment, but we're not sure what you'd like to happen. In particular, we're not sure what you would like to happen to the taxes and the pricing structures. 

The UK Government are not responsible for funding meat alternatives. 

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the UK Parliament and Government to do. For example, you could start a new petition asking the UK Government and Parliament to introduce a new tax on meat, with exemptions for free range meat, if that's what you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Ban the sale and use one off portable BBQ's.
attributes.background: To fast track and prohibit, through legislation, the sale or use of one off portable silver foil BBQ's.
attributes.additional_details: These one of portable BBQ's are a menace in the hands of irresponsible individuals and destructive to green spaces and delicate habitats. The resulting conflagrations is a serious risk to human life and the environment plus they are extremely costly and the recovery takes years as well as expenditure and effort. Statistics should be available within the system to justify the petition.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315762

attributes.action: Ban the prohibition of wearing face masks in school
attributes.background: Currently some schools are prohibiting the use of face masks for students and teachers. This should not be a mandated prohibition. This should be personal choice. Health decisions should be made by individuals and not by the school administrators.
attributes.additional_details: I want parliament to instruct schools that that the choice to wear or not wear face masks in the school environment should be left to personal choice until such a time as government make it mandatory. Prohibiting the use of face masks may have detrimental effects on children’s health both physically and mentally. Scientific evidence is changing to show it can reduce transmission of Covid especially in the pre-symptomatic stage. This decision is against civil liberties and needs to be reversed.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331468

attributes.action: Raise fixed penalty notices for littering the countryside and beaches to £1000+
attributes.background:
Help to preserve and protect our beautiful outdoor spaces, National Parks, and beaches by imposing higher fixed penalty fines for those dropping litter, and lighting barbecues on grass/moorland.

Fixed penalty notices should start at £1000 and be issued more readily, frequently and proactively.
attributes.additional_details:
Recent news reports have shown many of the country's much treasured beauty spots being desecrated by people leaving beer bottles, takeaway wrappers, disposable barbecues and general waste behind.

These spaces are slowly being spoilt, and currently there does not appear to be a big enough deterrent as far as fixed penalty notices, fines and prosecution.

We should all be able to enjoy outdoor spaces whilst respecting the environment and those who seek to damage it should face harsher penalties.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324488

attributes.action: Save Our Zoo’s
attributes.background: I want the government to reconsider their decision on adding zoo’s to the list of venues that are to remain closed indefinitely. Without visitors zoo’s are unable to survive and could be forced to close permanently. This would be a huge devastation and great loss to the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: I refer to both Chester and Twycross Zoo who have both reported significant debts that mount up to millions of pounds. Zoo’s provide so much support not only to wildlife and the environment, but also through the conservation projects that they carry out. Without immediate support our zoo’s are in great danger of becoming extinct themselves. I strongly urge you to reconsider your decision as a matter of urgency, before it’s too late.

attributes.action: CHANGE THE EUROCENTRIC CURRICULUM - TEACH BLACK HISTORY
attributes.background: Change the curriculum to include prominent black figures in history, praise all races from an early age, teach literature from written by black authors, educate on black led movements & successes, teach black students where they came from, & show white students what they’ve gained from BAME efforts.
attributes.additional_details: It is incredibly damaging for black youth to grow up thinking they are the underclass, which is reinforced when the most black history they are taught is slavery & MLK, which hardly scrapes the surface of all the positive influences/events in black history. Furthermore, it reinforces the institutional racism throughout society if white students are brought up in an environment which devalues black people, & ignores their existence. Black students need to feel liberated & this is the way forward.

rejection.details:

We have also published several petitions about race and equality more widely, which you can view here: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions?state=open&topic=race-and-equality

attributes.action: Encourage employers to allow their employees to work from home
attributes.background: During lockdown there has been a massive reduction on air pollution, much of which must be down to more people working from home.
attributes.additional_details: Less air pollution for everyone, better health and less illness. Wildlife returning to areas where they been absent for many years. Less time travelling by car and public transport = a cleaner environment, less time travelling for the employee, less stress, more quality time with family due to wasted travelling time.

attributes.action: Schools to remain close untill the Rate of Infection is 0.
attributes.background: The government should consider the wider scale of the disaster the COVID-19 has brought. Our children should not be the victims of collateral damage of our health measures.I am urging the government to reconsider their stance on the schools reopening. Schools should implement a phased in future
attributes.additional_details: I'm very worried for children like my 2 yr old being diagnosed with autism &speech delay. Like me, many parents with Special educational needs and disability children will know they require 1-2-1 support at all times. How is this acceptable on their mental health to implement social distance measures in order for them to be in a educational environment. Sensory delay has a huge impact, no matter on what scale the child is with Autism. Its UNACCEPTABLE! OUR CHILDREN ARE OUR FUTURE!

attributes.action: Ban bonfires during daylight hours
attributes.background: Ban any bonfires from occurring before dusk
attributes.additional_details:
Bonfires create excessive smoke which has an impact on the quality of air for the community. Everyone is entitled to fresh air, particularly in their own garden, and especially during the Covid-19 pandemic. Bonfires cause breathing difficulties and this is particularly dangerous for anyone suffering with Covid-19 symptoms, asthma and all babies and children.
It is also a strain on our emergency services when fires get out of control, and a strain on the environment when clothes need rewashing.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310468

attributes.action: Give every school a garden to improve health, learning & work opportunities.
attributes.background: Every single school should have a garden for health, systems learning, emotional & intellectual development, environmental resilience & sustainable work opportunities. Adapt a corner of a playground/sports field/car park to enable development of school curricula & resources for local communities.
attributes.additional_details: We know from decades of research globally that outdoor learning & 'garden school' pedgagogies are extremely beneficial for healthy development of children & youth, as well as for lifelong learning & health. We know from climate research that we urgently need to increase urban green space & protect biological diversity in our environment-locally, nationally & globally. Additionally, we know sustainable agricultural practices & food chains increase the resilience of local economies. A win-win.

rejection.details: The Government is not responsible for school premises. This is a matter for individual schools and relevant local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons.

attributes.action: More support for Year 10 and 12 following Covid-19 closing schools and colleges
attributes.background: Grade boundaries should be lowered for the 2021 exams, the current year 10 and 12 students.
attributes.additional_details: Year 10 and 12 students are preparing to take their GCSE or A Level exams in the year 2021 and following the closure of their learning environments many pupils are struggling to keep up with the high demand of work set with little or no help. The help that some students receive is not enough to ensure they reach their full potential in their exams. The students are also not participating in mock exams so universities will not see the potential these students have when applying to university.

rejection.details:
Decisions about exams are a matter for exam boards, individual schools and Ofqual, and are not a matter for the UK Government or Parliament.

attributes.action: Scrap HS2 and use the money to fund the NHS and elderly care
attributes.background: Use the money destined for HS2 to fund the NHS and elderly care.  This money would be better used for these causes which have been underfunded for years. Elderly care is disjointed and unfair on people who have saved their money.  Scrap Phase 2 of HS2 altogether and improve the rail network we have.
attributes.additional_details: By not building Phase 2 of HS2 and using the money for NHS and elderly care would ensure these causes would be adequately funded, the countryside and wildlife would be protected by not destroying woodlands and people would not be forced from their homes to make way for HS2, air quality would be improved and pollution lessened.  The abuse of nature would be less and people would be living in a better environment.  The rail network we have needs improving and this could be done at much less cost.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/311642

attributes.action: Stop owls being used in shopping centers
attributes.background: Owls are very precious birds. They deserve quality of life and not to be used in shopping centers for money. Holding them for photographs causes unnecessary stress.
attributes.additional_details: Owls should be free to fly and not chained to perches for hours. They shouldn't be in noisy environments as they have sensitive hearing.

rejection.details:
It's already a criminal offence to cause unnecessary suffering to an animal or for someone in charge of an animal permit any unnecessary suffering, so we're not sure what else you'd like the UK Government or Parliament to do. 

If you're worried about a specific animal, you can contact the police: https://www.police.uk/forces/ 
or the RSPCA:
https://www.rspca.org.uk/utilities/contactus/reportcruelty

You could also start a new petition asking the UK Government to review the animal welfare legislation and issue specific guidance to ensure the needs of birds are fully considered, if that's something you'd like to happen.

attributes.action: Psychological well-being assessments for emotional & physical abuse on children
attributes.background: Currently, The Multi Agency Safeguarding Hub do not perform psychological well-being assessments for all reported cases of physical & psychological abuse against children. They can simply choose to close the case simply after a phone call without even looking at the evidence.
attributes.additional_details: It should become law that a psychological well-being assessment is carried out by a senior qualified mental health professional for every reported case. Each family member should be assessed individually in a safe neutral environment to prevent parents who threaten or coerce a child not to tell the truth. Assessments should only end when the mental health professional is satisfied that there is no abuse. The Safeguarding Hub should not be allowed to close a case until the assessments are complete.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. We understand that the Multi Agency Safeguarding Hub is able to undertake assessments where necessary, but it's a decision for them on whether or not to undertake assesments. 

We're not sure whether you want assessments to take place whenever a referral takes place, regardless of whether the referral requires it. In any case the Government or Parliament can't mandate specific assessments or treatments, and we can't publish petitions that require medical assessments or treatments to happen.

attributes.action: Stop the 5G rollout until independent testing proves it universally safe
attributes.background: For the government to stop the use and rollout of all 5G technology and the 5G radio wave spectrum until independent peer-reviewed long-termed research has been conducted that assures it is safe to humans, wildlife and environmental health.
attributes.additional_details: To provide an independent peer-reviewed, unbiased evidence base on the health consequences from long-term exposure for humans, wildlife or the natural environment. The government must stop this rollout until the long-term effects have been assessed for humans, and all fauna and flora.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312997

attributes.action: Scrap bus fares in major cities permanently.
attributes.background: Mayor Khan has scrapped bus fares  in London temporarily due to Covid 19. Make this a permanent change for safer, quieter and healthier streets for every user with no congestion, cleaner air and a cleaner  environment. Children travel free already , now let's do it for everyone and the environment
attributes.additional_details: The Government has the power and legislative ability to make such a big change happen.  Buses can be funded from a small increase in  general taxation or property taxes which will have massive savings for all users and families and increased use of buses will increase frequency and a virtuous cycle of increasing bus use while reducing carbon from cars. Roads will be safer for all users including children cycling or walking. Healthier air, reduced carbon, and healthier more active lifestyles.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This would be a matter for local councils.

You could start a petition for the Government to subsidise all bus transport in England, if that's what you'd like to see happen.
